channel.title: [PI] Quest Tab Help [PI] ~~2 PAGES~~
channel.description: Okay, I Want The Quest Tab To Look Something Like This: [code]Players Online: 20 PkP: 2568 Player Status: Owner Donator Status: Donater[/code] How Do I Do The Player Status And Donator Status?

item.title: [PI] Quest Tab Help [PI] ~~2 PAGES~~
item.dc:creator: @_C_oder_P_erses [C]oder [P]erses
item.description:
@_C_oder_P_erses wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]The variable was ‘donator’ not ‘donated.’

public String getDonor() { if (donator == 0) return "Non-Donator"; if (donator == 1) return "Donator"; return "Non-Donator"; }[/quote]ahahah, just noticed before you said that lol Thanks Man

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Quest Tab Help [PI] ~~2 PAGES~~
item.dc:creator: @_C_oder_P_erses [C]oder [P]erses
item.description:
@_C_oder_P_erses wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Yes.[/quote]Here Is My Compiling Error:

src/server/model/players/Client.java:1369: cannot find symbol symbol : variable donated location: class server.model.players.Client if (donated == 0) ^ src/server/model/players/Client.java:1371: cannot find symbol symbol : variable donated location: class server.model.players.Client if (donated == 1) ^ 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Quest Tab Help [PI] ~~2 PAGES~~
item.dc:creator: @_C_oder_P_erses [C]oder [P]erses
item.description:
@_C_oder_P_erses wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Okay, so the variable is the same as the text String.

So yeah, your code should work.[/quote]So This Should Work?:

public String getDonor() { if (donated == 0) return "Non-Donator"; if (donated == 1) return "Donator"; return "Non-Donator"; }

Read full topic

item.description:
@_C_oder_P_erses wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]That’s only a text String. Go up until you see token.equals(“donated”)

The variable should be under that.[/quote] p.donator = Integer.parseInt(token2); That?

item.title: [PI] Quest Tab Help [PI] ~~2 PAGES~~
item.dc:creator: @_C_oder_P_erses [C]oder [P]erses
item.description:
@_C_oder_P_erses wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]No.

PlayerSave class writes variables to any String of text.

So if the character said: “omg-this-is-the-players-location-lolol=just-kidding-its-player-rights”
I could have it write the (p.playerRights) variable to it.

Look in the PlayerSave class until you see the donator variable.[/quote]okay, found this:

			characterfile.write("donated = ", 0, 10);

Read full topic

public String getDonor() { if (donated == 0) return "Non-Donator"; if (donated == 1) return "Donator"; return "Non-Donator"; } Right?
[/quote]That looks about right.[/quote]Okay, It Is All Right But The Variable… Isn’t That The Thing That It Say’s In Char Files?
